plausible_answers.text: fill vacancies that arose among the cardinal bishops

qas.question: What were long-serving cardinal priests entitled to do ending in the mid-fifteenth century?
What are cardinal deacons of eight years standing still entitled to become?
Who has not been advanced to cardinal bishop exclusively by papal appointment?
How have cardinals been advance to cardinal priests?
Who filled vacancies that arose among the cardinal priests?

context: For a period ending in the mid-20th century, <b4_0>long-serving cardinal priests<b4_0/> were entitled to <b0_0>fill vacancies that arose among the cardinal bishops<b0_0/>, just as cardinal deacons of ten years' standing are still entitled to become <b1_0>cardinal priests<b1_0/>. Since then, <b2_0>cardinals<b2_0/> have been advanced to cardinal bishop <b3_0>exclusively by papal appointment<b3_0/>.
